Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but no lifts until 03 April 2102”
Reviews.Author: Scotts62
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed are stay at the La Senat for three nights 09 -12 March. Lots of steps!! Beware if you have mobility issues as there are no lifts until 03 April 2102. The rooms where decorated nicely and the deluxe room were spacious. Unfortunately, there was a water leak in the bathroom which forced us to change rooms at 11:45PM! But the staff did their best to manage the situation. The staff were very polite, helpful, and spoke fluent English. The location was just perfect - just a short walk to Jardin du Luxembourg and 15 minutes’ walk to the Seine. There are lots of nice restaurants in the area. I can recommend the stunning Art Nouveau Bouillon Racine . http://www.bouillon-racine.com/en/home/index.html off Boulevard St Michelle. And the restraint next door but one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: AandCTWells
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the end of February. When we arrived we were upgraded by the hotel to a terrace suite (6th and 7th floors). Very spacious, two floor, suite with a terrace with the most fabulous views over the roof tops of Paris, including all the main sights. Well worth it if you can afford it. We got an excellent deal through Cresta holidays - 3 nights including breakfast and the Eurostar, for the price the hotel were advertising the room only for one night. As other guests have said, the decor was beginning to look slightly worn (although still very good). As we left, however, they were embarking on a massive refit of all the rooms, starting with the top floors. Very quite location but walking distance to all the sights except the Sacre Cour. Definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money for Parisian standards”
Reviews.Author: ckAthens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Senat for three nights at the end of February, and we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff was great, really helpful, speaking fluent English, the location was just perfect - just a minute away from the wonderful Jardin du Luxembourg and had numerous restaurant options around it. Le Senat is easily accessible by either RER or the metro, as it is just between the Jardins du Luxembourg RER station and the Odeon metro. The room we stayed was kind of small, but then again you can't expect much from a hotel in Paris... The hotel, though recently refurbished, looked a little tired, with some parts of the -otherwise brand new - bathroom paint chipping off the walls and ceiling, while the wall paper in the room could use some cleaning. In any case... we would definately go back if we got the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location,reasonable rooms,staff not too helpful”
Reviews.Author: AloysiusTrequanda
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the hotel 1st time.Choice was made based on very positive reviews.Staff was contrary to reviews less than helpful.Rooms are adequate and location is fine.If you are looking for a home away from home this is not your place.For business its ok but there are better choices for sure and for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Just booked a return trip”
Reviews.Author: Karin S
Reviews.Content: Small, quiet hotel. Connveniently located to the Luxumbourg Garden. TAKE NOTE RUNNERS: It's a great place to go to for several laps if you need your morning exercise or walk!. Also close to great shops, restaurants, and the metro. Safe area. Rooms are small, but hey, it's Paris. If you're like me, you're not in your room for long and only long enough to rest your head. The majority of the time is spent exploring the city! Well priced, knowledgeable and English-speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelinJoeSePa
Reviews.Content: Spend about 1 week per month in Paris on business. Discovered this hotel last fall and have been staying there since (instead of a generic business hotel on the periphery). Being in the middle of things in this neighborhood has made going to Paris interesting again. Hotel is small, and you can stand in the middle of the room and touch all 4 walls in some rooms they are so small. But who cares? You're staying in the middle of Paris. Get out and live! Hotel is clean though some things are a little beat up. Rates are reasonable and mine has always included breakfast and wifi. Metro and RER B and C are both a short walk. Luxembourg Garden is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Super location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: marieke13
Reviews.Content: Staying 2 nights in the hotel Le Senat was definitly worth it. It is in a prime location, very close to Jardin de Luxembourg, Le Marais, Ile de la Cité, Le bon Marché, perfect !. The rooms are as big as you can get for Parisien terms, bathroom is good with Hermès products (always nice). Staff is friendly, Wifi should work (but not always). And don't take breakfast, cause you can get it much cheaper somewere else. But the hotel is good value for money comparing to other hotels in that area. It has a boutique charm, modern style. Loved Paris again....

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: doug c
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Senat during a Christmas holiday to Paris. The hotel was excellent with nice clean rooms and a first rate breakfast. However, the most outstanding issue was the level of service provided by the front desk and other staff. They went out of their way to help us book cars and trains. far beyond what we have received at other hotels. Amele at the front desk was particularly helpful and responsive. Highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable. Clean. Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: ivanka_v
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, modern yet smallish (ie. boutique-like but on the practical side) hotel at a superb location. Comfortable bed, clean modern bathrooms, rooms on the smaller side (but that's to be expected) - otherwise perfect for a long weekend in Paris type thing. Excellent value for money for a 3 star hotel at this location if you are paying the reduced rate (as we did) - not really worth the higher/advertised rate as at that level there are other very good hotels in the area. One down side - we had a room at a lower level facing the street (which gets quite noisy at night/early morning; opt for a higher level/non-street facing room if possible) Otherwise- recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our 4 day trip”
Reviews.Author: FromNYto?
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem. Unpretentious. Calm. Perfectly located for attractions as well as just wandering. I would say opt for one of the top rooms with a terrace. The view was spectacular and it was fun to have a glass a wine at night. One note though, the staircase is narrow in the duplex and the toilet is downstairs while the bedroom is upstairs. The front desk was very accommodating. Wifi great. Bed comfortable. I will say I do agree with some of the reviewers that it is time for facelift for the hotel. There's some peeling paint in the hallway and some frayed rugs here and there, some furniture with banged up edges. For us, it did not diminish the stay one bit BUT if this is the kind of thing that bothers you, you may not feel you are getting a good value.

Reviews.Title: “small room and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: mollysouthisland
Reviews.Content: The location was great and we were able to walk to the Notre Dame and surrounding tourist sights. It was lovely having a cafe at the end of the street and restaurants around the corner. The hotel was close to the metro stations which we used alot. I loved the reception area and found the staff very helpful as my french is very bad! The twin room at the front of the hotel was very small, no where to put two suitcases which was alittle frustrating. The bathroom was very small, no where to move and having to go sideways just to get to the toilet was interesting.I am no stick figure but that was slightly ridiculous.The lift was very small and could only fit one person with luggage. It was a cute hotel and I would stay again as the location was so good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Adriana A
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is close to all the attractions, we walked to most of them. There are a few metro stations close by. The area was also excellent, close to La Sorbonne and Notre Dame, also many restaurants around. The staff is also very helpful. However, the price we payed was a little high but we booked it in the last minute, literally the day before we arrived in high season.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Recovery and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: Naboozal
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Le Senat in mid September. Booked thru Expedia and when we arrived, Terrence apologized as they had reserved a one bed deluxe room even though we booked a 3 person room. He could see in his paperwork that indeed we did book for three and arranged for us to be upgraded into two separate rooms for the first night, one which was their top 2 floor suite which had a great rooftop patio overlooking the city. While it was a pain to have 2 separate rooms and not be able to completely settle in until night 2, this was a nice treat for my wife and 10 year old daughter. The beds and pillows are very comfy. However, the doors are paper thin with noise coming in from the halls, stairs and elevator (we were right next to all three in room #201) once 9am hit. If you like sleeping in, beware of this. Overnight though, it was very quiet. The room was ok in size and there was a separate water closet and shower rooms, which were very tiny. The room was clean overall, AC worked great, and TV worked well. Internet was also good to have but a pain that you needed to reenter the wi-fi log in data after each session. We didn't do the breakfast and saved the money by eating from the local area, which had plenty of options. Freshly made crepes and quiche were steps away from the hotel's entrance. Local grocery was also nearby for snacking and wine purchases. A pharmacy was also very close. If you like to run, the interior loop of Luxembourg Gardens was filled with runners and it's about 1 mile per loop... a beautiful view while jogging. Some great restaurants are within a short walk as well. The Luxembourg RER is only a 5 minute walk and can get you pretty much anywhere in Paris in under 30 minutes. The staff at the front desk was helpful and all spoke very good english. Would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: femmenoiredumonde
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice size rooms, great location and excellent service. For those familiar with Paris, this is not always easy to get all 3 at once, so this hotel is a steal. It is located across from the Luxembourg Gardens and near lots of cute cafes. Perfect for couples or single travelers, not really a hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria Prats H
Reviews.Content: Le Senat is a lovely hotel located in Saint Germain-des-Pres. You can walk all of Paris from this great location. The rooms are comfortably-sized, well-decorated, and very clean. The beds and linens are exceptional. We stayed in Room 601, which has a desk and sitting area, as well. Situated near the Luxembourg Gardens, it has many nearby shops, restaurants, markets, wine rooms, and public transportation stations. We took the RER-B from Charles de Gaulle airport to the Luxembourg station, (30 minute ride) about one block from the hotel. Breakfast is plentiful (croissants, breads, pastries, scrambled eggs, yogurt, cheeses, bacon, sausage and ham, cereals) and served in a charming room. The staff is the greatest part of this place - most knowledgeable and accommodating. Free WiFi is a bit quirky. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in perfect location with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: HonestAndFair11
Reviews.Content: My husband stays at this hotel regularly when traveling to Paris for business so he recommended that we stay here for my first Paris visit. It is a lovely boutique hotel right next the Luxembourg garden and a metro station. In addition to the great location, the reception and housekeeping staff were very helpful and friendly. The only negative is that the rooms and bathroom are very small, especially for a couple. We only stayed three nights so the limited space wasn't a major issue but would have been if we stayed longer. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: luis c
Reviews.Content: My appreciation of the exemplary service I received during my recent stay at Le Senat Hotel cannot be overstated. Every staff member I met was friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. Thank you again for your considerate service. I will be certain to recommend your accommodations to my friends and business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: andymanc10
Reviews.Content: We've just got back and would recommend this hotel. The location is superb and you can walk to loads of the main sights. Lots of great restaurants are close by too. We paid for the upgrade to a terrace suite, so the views of Paris were amazing. Yes, the rooms are small and expensive compared to other cities, but it is Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Joan5513
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this hotel I was looking forward to staying there, unfortunately it didn't live up to expectations. Yes, the area is ideal and close to metro station but the hotel was a dissapointment. The room was very small as are most in Paris but there wasn't even a space to put your suitcases. There was no fridge or drinking water in the room either. The beds were very comfortable but the bathroom was very small and quite dangerous. I am of average height but had problems with the loo because of manoevering around the huge hand basin. There was no slip mat in the bath and the shower was falling to bits with water running out of the faulty faucet and flooding the floor. Breakfast is served in the basement and the area was very claustrophobic. The staff were very helpful and friendly but this didn't make up for the limitations of the hotel. I don't think I would stay there again, I have stayed in better in Paris for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Comfortable Bed, In the middle of everything...”
Reviews.Author: Rockeymoore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Although the rooms are small, they are very comfortable with a great bed and a nice marble bathroom. The front desk service was good and my husband enjoyed the free breakfasts in the basement of the hotel. What I liked most about this hotel is this it is directly across the street from Luxembourg Gardens and in the center of the Latin Quarter right next to the Sorbonne and near almost everything. We literally walked to Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay, and countless other sites of interest. I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “ooh la la....”
Reviews.Author: CoastalSalt
Reviews.Content: One of the best experiences ever in a hotel. Very friendly, clean beyond belief and great food. Located in a wonderful neighborhood with fabulous shops all within very easy walking distance. Reasonably priced, and the bed...wow, SO comfy! Good for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “"Great location and buy...."”
Reviews.Author: mharris1111
Reviews.Content: Hi: The location is fantastic, close to Pantheon, Siene, D'orsay, Notre Dame and L'ouvre, cafes on ST Germain and St Michal.....Hotel staff is very helpful(speak English), hotel makes you feel like your living in a real "Parisian" neighbourhood..... Great buy for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing return to long-time favorite”
Reviews.Author: VirtuallyAnywhere
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th or 7th stay at Le Senat in the past 4 years, and we have always looked forward to it. Unfortunately, this stay was quite disappointing. The primary issue is that the price keeps rising, but they do not appear to be investing in maintenance. This was beginning to be evident last winter, but has now become a real problem. With spots on the carpet, rotten wood framing near the tub and obvious signs of wear everywhere, it is definitely time for a facelift. (I will add a couple of pictures later when I have time.) The secondary issue was service, though it may be that the drop in standards was due to temporary help during the August holiday period. The receptionist was only able to help us with train schedule after we explained the service we had gotten without asking on a previous visit. And unlike past visits, they were not very welcoming of us as "repeat visitors". We do not expect complimentary upgrades to a suite every time (though twice in a row was nice), but the "superior" room we had this time required a traffic cop for us to go back and forth between the tiny bathroom and the only place in the room where suitcases would go. As we discussed potential options with the receptionist, we also brought up the "little touches" like a free bottle of mineral water, extra wine glasses, in-room fridge, etc. that we had come to expect from previous visits. We were somewhat curtly informed that those only come with "deluxe rooms". All in all it was quite disappointing. So much so that we will certainly look at other options for our next visit rather than simply booking "our favorite".

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff& Location”
Reviews.Author: ChilliRod
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The staff was very welcoming and made sure to help us with our needs The location is excellent, walking distance to the fabulous Jardins de Luxemboug. Near many great restaurants (make sure you hit Rue de Canettes' Pizzeria Positano)! The room is quite normal in size for Paris standards, but it is very nicely decorated. Hermes toiletries are a nice touch and the shower is pretty good. The only point I would make is that street the hotel is located is very small, so when you have to take your luggage out of the taxi for instance, you practically halt traffic! Would definitely stay at Le Senat again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: tpadvisorwalker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer and thought I had written a review before now, however I posted it on a Paris forum. Having never visited Paris before we decided with 2 days notice to go! We booked this hotel and got a wonderful deal of 100 euros per night including breakfast. I was shocked at the size of the room but I know that this is typical. The decor was tasteful and the bed comfortable but it was hard to shake the claustraphobic feeling. Saying that we didn't spend a lot of time indoors. The hotel is located very close to the Sorbonne, Notre Dame and the Luxembourg Gardens. The Gardens were a delight to rest in out of the sun in the middle of the day and to enjoy for a walk in the evenings. We thought Bike About Paris was a must to do and something we still talk about a year later. You can find them outside Notre Dame and they organise groups to sightsee round the city on bikes. It made our stay in Paris and was the best introduction we possibly could have had. At the end they gave us a list of restaurants and tips to use for the rest of our stay. One of the restaurants happened to be 3 doors up from Le Senat and it was filled with locals and was fantastic. We are returning to Paris in 6 weeks to another hotel in this area in the hope of getting a little bit more space but for the money we paid we were well served by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “July 2011 at Le Senat”
Reviews.Author: pearl018
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous and helpful. The rooms were small, however typical of European hotels. The breakfast was decent and their staff was accomodating. The lobby is okay, nothing special however. I would rate the hotel on a scale of 1-10 as a 7.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star near Luxembourg Gardens”
Reviews.Author: sam252511
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a too short stay at this great little hotel. The location is fantastic and the recently renovated room was a decent size for the price. The staff was wonderful--friendly and helpful. It even has room service!! We plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, very small, tastefully furnished rooms”
Reviews.Author: queenh
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the St. Germain district is centrally located for walking to museums and shopping, with many nearby affordable small and large restaurants. The staff is very friendly with daily newspapers in many languages and free internet and Wi-Fi. The rooms have been tastefully refurbished, but are quite small, but adequate considering the ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly and efficient multilingual staff”
Reviews.Author: irvilia
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel has an excellent location across from the Parc de Luxembourg and close to the Pantheon. Our room was kind of small but it was very quiet, the bed was very comfortable and we had a street view. The hotel provides a computer you can use and they will also lend you an i-pad loaded with a variety of newspapers to take up to your room. There are both Metro and RER stops nearby as well as restaurants and cafes and all kinds of interesting shops. Right on the corner there is a very nice cafe that looks on the park and we had a very nice dinner practically next door at La Ferrandaise, a bistro with a very interesting menu and reasonable prices. On the down side the bathroom was tiny and uncomfortable. The shower doors had come a bit out of their frames and that made it more difficult to get in and out. They also need need to put a mirror over the desk in the room. All in all we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Pewterspears
Reviews.Content: Superb location with the Luxembourg Gardens just 100 yards away at the bottom of the road and the superb restaurant La Ferandaise right next door .Rooms are typical Paris size so worth going for more than their standard . A little pricier but there are sometimes deals to be had . The staff on the whole were friendly and helpful but one staff member stands out . Mauro . on both our stays here he always went that extra mile to make sure our stay in Paris was even more special.

Reviews.Title: “High-Standard 3-Star in Gorgeous Area”
Reviews.Author: jonathanhealy
Reviews.Content: The area around the Jardin du Luxembourg really is beautiful and this hotel is located on a fairly quiet street just off the gardens close to several metro stops. The reception staff were very courteous and professional and the hotel was one of the best 3-stars in which I've stayed in Paris from regular trips there over the years. The room was typically small in Parisian style, but tastefully furnished with a lovely bathroom (which had an excellent power shower and very nice toiletries). The room was fairly quiet, especially with the windows closed and A/C set on low for the night. While it was expensive for a s-star (we paid around €165/night), it was probably worth it for the overall experience. We stayed later in our trip in the Marais in a budget hotel and barely slept a wink for the two nights there!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely average in all respects, not a good value”
Reviews.Author: urbanspelunker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in May. I've been to Paris several times before, staying mostly in cheaper, small hotels in the 4th and 5th. We decided to splurge a bit and head for the 6th, and I was a little disappointed. I don't think the steep increase in price at Hotel Le Senat was worth what we got in return. The location is great, but the rooms are quite small. Contrary to the previous review, my Hong Kong hotel rooms were definitely larger than our standard room at Le Senat. There was not adequate room for 2 medium-sized suitcases in addition to the bed and desk. The bed was wonderful. The bathroom had a few cracks in the bathtub, and the much-touted Hermes toiletries weren't so impressive. It's a pet peeve of mine, but when a hotel doesn't provide conditioner in addition to shampoo, it's not worthy of boasting about its toiletries. The hair dryer was excellent. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel because it seemed much too expensive for what was offered, and there are plenty of cafes closeby anyways. The front desk staff was not particularly warm or friendly; they did what was needed but not with a smile. Next time we are in Paris we'll be back at a cheaper place in the Marais, with breakfast included and a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique chic in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: griggs79
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for her first trip to Paris. She is very well travelled throughout France, speking the language fluently but had always avoided the capital. Paris has a reputation throughout the rest of the country of it's residence being rude and surly. Well upon arrival the staff of the hotel did everything possible to dispel that myth. Other reviews will comment on how small the rooms are, and that is true. But when visiting a city like Paris, the only thing you need your room for is the bed, and the beds are luxurious. Just to put it in comparison, the rooms are large compared to a Hong Kong hotel. Breakfast was all that you could ask for a mixture of a cooked and continental breakfast served with superb Cafe o'lait. We had the misfortune of leaving a credit card in the safe of the hotel, however before we had even arrived home the hotel had contacted us by email to tell us. So easily they could have just ignored the fact. The location of the hotel is superb. A five minute walk from the heart of swanky St Germain, and with a Metro station just a stones throw away. If you are looking for traditional down to earth French food Restaurant Polidor is just around the corner, popular for over 150 years and one of the few open in the whole of Paris. If it wasn't for this Hotel I doubt we would look back on a visit with such fondness, for many of the tourist highlights we weren't able to visit; Eiffel Tower, broken, Musse D'Orsay, shut etc... In summary a fab little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: retiredtraveller2
Reviews.Content: Our room was relatively small but I have never had a big room in a Parisian hotel of this class! The room was clean and the shower/bath and toilet were a reasonable size. The bed was very comfortable. Shower had a good flow of hot water. Sound proofing between rooms might be improved. Breakfast was good although not a lot of choice. Worth getting the breakfast included in the room rate. Just the one lift so you might wait at busy times - we didnt have a problem. Staff were friendly and had a good standard of English. The hotel is in a side street but very close to the Luxembourg Gardens. Metro and RER stops are nearby. Lots of choice of restaurants and bars in the area. Would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: svalkenborg
Reviews.Content: I did enjoy this hotel because of the fantastic location and welcoming staff. The rooms are very very small. Great bed. A standard bathroom that needs some touching up. Although the cleaning lady forgot to clean on necessairy places. also hotel only provides 1 elevator which makes waitingtimes long!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and blissful beds”
Reviews.Author: Nics17
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I have stayed at Le Senat and it never disappoints. It' s in a fantastic location served by a number of bus routes to main attractions - much better for sight-seeing than the Metro. You are spoilt for choice with a range of local eateries and Au Petit Suisse next door is great for a nightcap and people-watching. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. Some of the rooms have an awkward layout but this is more than made up for by the queen-sized beds that are blissfully comfortable. I have stayed at other hotels in Paris but since discovering Le Senat I won't be trying anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location from which to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: islandhopScotland
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel. Rooms are small ("superior" room I think is actually standard) but comfortable. This hotel is situated on a small side street so traffic noise is possibly less than other hotels I looked at (and walked past when there) which were on big main roads. Jardin de Luxembourg is beautiful and right on the doorstep. Many sights within easy walking distance. We walked everywhere except to take the RER to and from CDG airport (very easy)and the Luxembourg RER station is a very short walk away. Loads of restaurants, cafes and patisserie nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great location, perfect room, friendly staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: Rad_10
Reviews.Content: I came here for a 3-day trip with my teenage son. The hotel was chosen with a Eurostar package and was great value. Before arriving, I exchanged emails with the reception to organise a couple of things and they were really helpful. The location is fantastic - close to REF, Metro, Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon, Latin Quarter, Saint-Germain, and in the heart of a beautiful part of Paris. Room was really clean, great beds, well equipped bathroom, air con. It was quiet at night - an advantage of having a room overlooking the inner courtyard! The staff were really friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel, but went to one of many local cafes. If you come, try and book a room with a view - something you rarely get with the package deals. Either way, its a great place and I would return here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Clare186534
Reviews.Content: The view from our balcony was amazing and the room was cozy. Ridiculously comfortable bed, have never experienced that in a hotel. It was in a cool location and easy to re-find every day after being out exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jlh159
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife while mixing business and pleasure. Here are my general thoughts: Staff -- extremely nice and fluent in English. Made reservations for me, tipped me on attire for one of my finer dining experiences, and gave me directions/pointers when I needed them. Definitely the best asset this hotel has. Rooms -- Clean and was made up each day, though the toiletries weren't replenished regularly. That didn't bother me but it might some. The size was fine and if you've traveled in Europe at all you'll probably agree these are generous. I had a room facing the street and was on the 2nd floor, yet I had no issue with street noise. Part of that is due to its... Location -- a bit of a walk from the Metro, but it turns out that is a good thing. The area around the Metro is quite the party area and I could imagine the street noise and general shenanigans would be distracting when you're trying to sleep. Overall though this area is wonderful. Plenty of shops, close walking to fine chocolatiers, bakeries, and restaurants from sandwiches to nice meals. I'd definitely stay in this area again. Overall, when I go back to Paris I'll probably stay here again. I'd absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for a a boutique hotel that is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rzte1106
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel using my Delta frequent flyer miles, so I'm unaware of the price per night, and my breakfast was included as well. I stayed for 2 nights. I reserved a small double room, and it was very small for 2 people, but it was quite nice and very clean. I was sightseeing the entire time in Paris so I wasn't in the room much. The room did have a window that I could open for fresh air and nice light. The bed is big and very comfortable. I would rather have a bigger bed, then room to walk around so the fact that the room was small didn't bother me much. The bathroom is great. Again on the smaller side, but not lacking in fine touches. And remember this is Paris, all the rooms are going to be on the smaller side. The hotel has a small lift. It also has free wi-fi but it was kind of a pain. I have an iPhone, and I had to keep logging in on my phone to use it. There is also a community computer in the lobby. The staff at this hotel was fabulous. They were very nice and very helpful. The breakfast was good because it was included in my room price and very convienent. Coffee, tea juice. Breads eggs and meats. Cheeses, yogurts and fruits. There is a nice bar in the hotel too. I used that at night to sit and have a glass of wine. Its a great option to be able to order or drink or even take it back up to your room. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will return.”
Reviews.Author: Perpetua43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Senat for three nights in February 2011. The room was small but smartly furnished, with a comfortable bed and modern bathroom. The hotel is located on a quiet side street just beside the Luxembourg Garden (5 minutes) and within walking distance of Notre Dame(25 minutes ), Louvre( 45 minutes) ,etc. There is good access to public transport and the hotel is situated five minutes from the RER line to CDG Airport. There are several metro stations close by and bus routes just round the corner. There are numerous restaurants and bars in the immediate vicinity so you don't have to travel far to have an excellent meal in most prices ranges. The breakfast buffet had a good selection of fruit, croissants, cold meat, cheese, cereals, yogurts and pancakes along with beacon, eggs and spicy sausages. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially the night staff. We would highly recommend this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: bern21
Reviews.Content: Small hotel w/ friendly staff willing to go the extra mile. Always helpful. Room is small,but perfectly adequate. Terrific location. We were able to walk anywhere we wanted to go & we did.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in anexcellent location with lovely, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ScotsRomantic
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a quietish side street beside the gorgeous Jardins de Luxembourg this is a gem. A superb welcome and great service throughout our stay. Nice bedrooms, if a little small, but lovely clean bathroom and great linen. In a terrific location to explore Paris by foot or Metro, this is a great base for seeing the City and sampling its culture and cuisine. Lots of good eating and drinking locations within the neighbourhood. Nice even just to sit in teh small bar or the well-appointed little library. Very adequate breakfast with plenty of choice. This was excellent value for money. I don't want to tell too many people about it, or it will be too busy to take our return booking !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: maggie2791
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel to the north of the Luxembourg Gardens in a quiet street. The hotel itself was lovely, and the staff were helpful. Breakfast had a good selection of fruit, croissants, cold meat, cheese, cereals and pancakes. The bread was cut into small pieces which was annoying. A point to mention -we booked a superior room but the hotel rooms apparently start at superior - there are no standard rooms! Our room was tiny and the bathroom cluttered. Our toilet seat broke (it had been loose from the outset) and the shower screen let water on to the floor in a big way so we could not use it to shower. You could hear voices and toilet noises from adjacent rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and confortable hotel, excellent location, outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: IRibeiro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Senat for Christmas and New Years, during the holiday season in 2010. My husband and I travelled with our two teenager kids and my sister- and brother-in-law. We had a very good experience, enjoying the beautiful location and surroundings (just beside the Luxembourg Garden, at walking distance from Notre Dame, Louvre, etc) . The staff was always quite helpful with suggestions of restaurants (the food at Le Comptoir, close-by, is excellent), arrangements for transportation, etc. The rooms are certainly not very large, however from prior experience the size is quite reasonable for Paris. It is well furnished, with confortable bedsheets of good quality. The bathroom is not very large, but modern, with granite floors, good towels and the nice detail of Hermés shampoo, soap, etc. We certainly would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Miniscule rooms”
Reviews.Author: hmamsterdam
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, good location, helpful staff but miniscule rooms. Even by Parisian standards. We had a "family room" consisting of a comfortable double bed and a fold-out sofa. There was no room to maneuver, never mind finding somewhere to place our weekend bags (we wouldn't have managed if we'd had proper luggage with us). Bathroom also miniscule. Don't recommend hotel for a family visit but fine for a single or couple.

Reviews.Title: “Update: Still the best!”
Reviews.Author: VirtuallyAnywhere
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times since my original review on Trip Advisor, but this continues to live up to all expectations. The staff have remained more or less constant for three years, and it shows. They recognize me when I check in, and even though I know they have relied upon the computer for help, it is still a nice choice. The are always very helpful about dining or shopping options in the area, too. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but very nice. The location is fabulous with easy access to both airports via RER and plenty of shopping/strolling/dining areas nearby. (Be sure to check out the Dalloyau bakery nearby, and a short walk to Les Papilles will give you a wonderful dining experience.) They also have a small, comfortable bar area and a great library/sitting room for guests. I already have my reservations for the next time. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, and great music!”
Reviews.Author: Teiresias
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights from the 3rd-5th Novermber, and couldn't have been happier. Room was clean, quiet, and smartly decorated - it was a little small, but then this is Paris - almost all the rooms are small. Breakfast was fine, and front desk were helpful, providing us with directions to a decent restaurant when was arrived quite late on the Wednesday. When I ordered room service it was quick, and the shower was very good, nice and powerful to wake you up in the morning. I'd definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Burbankre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in mid-October. The hotel was very modern and has obviously recently been nicely remodeled. The location is superb and the staff was wonderful and accommodating. Our only complaints: the room was quite small, and both the breakfast buffet and the "express" (continental) breakfast were pricey. The hotel is not inexpensive either -- we've stayed in the same area for less.

Reviews.Title: “friendly,courteous,efficientstaff..centrally located”
Reviews.Author: peachtree12
Reviews.Content: We were forced to end our vacation early because of strikes,but Terrence and the whole staff helped with trains, cabs in order for us to leave early.The hotel is surrounded by bistros,shopping,sites,gardens and yet the location is quiet. we will certainly return as soon as we can and thank the staff for smiles in a tough situation.Joanne and Tom

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly staff; great location”
Reviews.Author: njRieslinglovers
Reviews.Content: Thank you, Terence for all your help with restaurants! The staff could not be friendlier or more helpful. We were upgraded to a top floor "suite", with 2 levels, a half bath and sofa and TV on the bottom level, up stairs was the main bathroom with shower and sinks (no toilet upstairs) and large closet. Lots of room in the up bedroom, well decorated, Hermes toiletries (shampoo and soap, but no hair conditioner!) Overall a great location just off the Luxembourg Gardens near the Odeon. Lots of great cafes and restaurants within walking distance. We walked all over Paris from our hotel. Hotel is modern and service was great. Only negative: getting off the elevator, the carpet was worn and had a sour odor (almost like vomit...). But in the room we did not notice it. Loved Terence, so helpful. A great choice, you'll love it. As with all of Paris, not exactly cheap, but we felt a good value for the hotel's amenities and location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: croissantsgalore
Reviews.Content: we had connecting rooms for our two small children. Friendly, helpful reception staff, very good breakfast and staff serving it, bed very comfortable; quiet location very conveniently located for exploring Paris. We got rooms on the fifth floor that had a balcony which was fun, as could stand or sit on it and admire the very Parisian view up and down the street below. One hot evening we did so listening to some lovely classical music drifting fromt where we d not know!

Reviews.Title: “Good Find”
Reviews.Author: 255060Jane
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at Le Senat and would certainly stay there again. The location is excellent - close to main shopping streets, major tourist sights, metro stations and restaurants of varied types and prices. The hotel itself is pleasant and comfortable with a good breakfast included in the price. However the friendly and helpful staff (who speak good English) are the feature of this hotel that make it stand out. Whether it is recommending anearby restaurant (and providing a map to get you there), arranging a shuttle bus to the airport or advising where to find a particular type of shop, they are able to help.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: ems066
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at Le Senat; we stayed nearby at a competitor's hotel. When our trip to Barcelona was delayed because of a strike, we found ourselves scrambling for a hotel room. We did not receive much help from the night staff at the place where we had stayed before and had been told there was no room at a few hotels where we had inquired. I'm sure the gentleman staffing the front desk on 28 September could see the desperation when we came in to inquire if there was a room - there was not. This gentleman went far beyond his duties and made phone calls for us (we speak little French) in order to reserve a room for us at a nearby hotel. We thanked him, of course, and tried to tip him (Americans that we are), but he refused the money. His willingness to provide excellent service to visitors - even if they are not staying at his hotel - speaks volumes about the quality of this establishment. The location is fantastic, the lobby was stylish, sure, but we were impressed most by the outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning but small boutique style hotel, perfect location - very central to all things Parisian”
Reviews.Author: StephVince
Reviews.Content: Our room was a bit smaller than I anticipated however the room was immaculately clean, fresh and 'chic' modern with a small balcony overlooking narrow streets and old buildings with character. It seemed that every corner we turned heading away from Le Senat we came upon very grand buildings of historical significance - amazing experience before even arriving at the popular landmarks ie Notre Dame, Louvre etc which are only 10-15 minutes walk. Not a huge selection for breakfast but all foods provided were very fresh and tasty. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay at Le Senat again.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel with excellent, professional & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sdjt
Reviews.Content: Second trip to Paris and the Left Bank. This time with a 5 yr old. We highly recommend this hotel for all travelers to Paris. The location places you close to tourist destinations but also makes you feel like a "local" due to its off the main road placement. Also the staff (Charley & Robin) will professionally address all your tourist and business needs in a friendly and proficient manner. Quiet, relaxing setting and extremely comfortable beds assist in ridding the jet lag that traveling from the West Coast of California will produce. If you want the big American hotel feel, try a Hilton etc but if you want a very enjoyable and French feel to you trip, visit Hotel Senat. We will be visiting Paris again and will be staying at Hotel Senat. If you are a business traveler and looking for a quiet place to stay with attentive staff stay here. If your business needs are to entertain clients this hotel may not be for you. This Hotel is a well placed sanctuary and should be viewed as such. Hotel Senat was recommended to us by two people, who are completely different from us but had the same great experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel but a great location in the St Germain area”
Reviews.Author: SandalGirl21
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Le Senat, I think mainly due to the location of the hotel and the local feel the neighbourhood had. We had a deluxe room booked but there was still no room to put our suitcases anywhere, they had put so much extra furniture in the room it made it even more cramped. The rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and lovely Hermes toiletries were provided too. It was about a 15mins walk to the Lourve but it was the beautiful boutiques, art galleries and bakeries that we passed along the way that made it more special. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, preferring to find a local bakery and sample their pastries.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with very friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Unkown
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very quiet but convenient neighborhood. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. My wife and I spent four nights in a suite with terrace. The price is very reasonable, and we are very pleased with our room, given the Paris standard. Overall I highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Paris for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: LurcherRalph
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, within a few minutes walk of the Luxembourg Gardens and Notre Dame. Our room was small but spotlessly clean and comfortable. Breakfast was adequate and staff members friendly and helpful. Overall this hotel is worth a visit - being within walking distance of many Paris attractions saves £s in transport costs and the near by district of St Germain is vibrant yet relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding anniversary choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: ektownsend
Reviews.Content: Managed to get a 'stay 2nights and get 3rd night free' with ASDA travel so feel that really got great value for money. Brilliantly located. 3min walk from 'Luxembourg' Metro station with all other stations easily accessible. Reception staff extremely helpful. Room wonderful with nice feather-down quilt and pillows (a pleasant change from some hotels). Breakfast to suit all tastes; pastries, cereals, fruit, bread, sausage/bacon/scrambled egg, hot drinks, juices. Free wi-fi - udername/password given to you upon arrival. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: BonnieClyde2024
Reviews.Content: Second time in Hotel le Senat. Simply perfect. Nice neighbourhood, friendly staff. Asked for a room in upper floor in advance and got one on the 5th floor with balcony! Highly recommandable.

Reviews.Title: “Chic decor, comfy bed, nice staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: chsblk
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2 nights at Hotel le Senat. Although the room was small, it was not claustrophobiic b/c of the pleasing decor. We liked the room location with view of the street and nice big window that opened. The bathroom was pretty and clean. The room was clean, except for some dust build up in the curtains. Erwan was especially helpful at the front desk and the taxi he secured for our ride to the airport was nice. If we had been staying longer than 2 nights, we would have needed a bigger room and more space to store clothes, etc., but since we were on the tail end of our trip to France, we did not unload our suitcases, so this room was quite sufficient for our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff saved our vacation when stranded by train cancellation”
Reviews.Author: DebbieandRobToronto
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent chose this hotel for us, and we couldn't have been happier. The location is wonderful - close to everything. It is a charming "boutique" style hotel. Of course rooms are small by North American standards (and the elevator!), but this is Europe. The beds were extremely comfortable. However, Charlie and Romain at the front desk, went above and beyond the call of duty. We were stranded in Nice when all the trains were cancelled by a flood. I didn't know anyone else to call, as it was the middle of the night back home. We were going to miss our last night in Paris and would likely miss our flight back to Canada. I called Charlie, who was invaluable. With his and Romain's assistance (it would take to long to tell the whole story here, but its quite dramatic!), we were able to make it back to Paris. They greeted us at the door when we finally arrived - Charlie offered us a drink at the bar, and upgraded us to the best suite in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Chrislmartin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 16 day trip to London, Paris, Venice, Florence and Rome. The Hotel Le Senat was by far the most comfortable, convenient, and hospitable hotel of all. The staff was excellent, the room was modern and serene, COLD a/c, one room with pocket doors that made it behave as 2 rooms for privacy for our teenage son, TWO bathrooms, one with a shower (very tiny) and one with a wonderful bath, super-comfortable bed, quiet. By European standards, the room was spacious. The wireless connection worked great for us as well. I would recommend to anyone. The neighborhood is fantastic. Any negatives? We all need to lose weight if the 3 of us wish to use the elevator together! LOL.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PurpleJ
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a great european vacation and stayed in the left bank at Le Senat Hotel May 29-June 1st. We thought the location was ideal, on a quiet side street, 1/2 block from the Luxenbourg Gardens and accessible to other tourist attractions. Note the metro was required for to the Eifel Tower. We requested a room with a balcony, room 505 which faced the street and was away from the elevator. The room and bathroom were small but modern. The staff extremely friendly and helpful, well versed in English. Breakfast was part of the rate and good. However because of the size of the room I'm not sure I would stay there for a longer stay. There was not any room for luggage bags or drawers to put away clothes. The bed was very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerryS2
Reviews.Content: Perfect Left Bank hotel across from Jardin Luxembourg and three to six streets from all Left Bank sites. Great staff, good breakfast, and pleasant location. Rooms and elevator on the smallish side, but typical of the city. Good value for Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Staff, Great Decor”
Reviews.Author: Irunchick
Reviews.Content: The staff were incredibly friendly and were really helpful. The hotel is really close to Luxembourg RER, St Germain Blvd. But such narrow corridors and tiny room. In our room bathroom and toilet were separate (in different parts of the room) is not comfortable. Olso I don`t like pictures of smoking old men, not romantic(((

Reviews.Title: “Our haven away from home”
Reviews.Author: roselady
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The location is wonderful. It's steps from the Luxembourg Gardens which we visited almost every day. Our room was small but had everything we needed. Felt like it had just been redone. Beds were comfortable with wonderful linens. We even had a closet to store our clothes. The bathroom was like new but small. Instant hot water! Only negative was the noise from the room next door. Breakfast was in the basement. Eggs, bacon, pastries, breads, meats, yogurt. Everything we wanted and needed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, wonderful location and great breakfast, lookforward to staying there again on our next trip.”
Reviews.Author: Frederick15
Reviews.Content: Enjoy yourself, the employees do a wonderful job in making the visit very pleasurable and informative and go out of their way to assist in everyway.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xaves99
Reviews.Content: Of the many hotels we stayed in on this trip of a month to London and Paris this was my favourite. The location is superb, I love St Germain and the Latin Quarter and being a few blocks away from St Germain Blvd - but close enough to enjoy the latter also - meant that our focus included streets we may not otherwise have visited. This led us to a wine bar and some restaurants that were frequented to a large extent by locals. The staff are unfailingly helpful and kind- I was stuck at CDG in the ash crises in its initial stages and although I got out by changing my airline and destination (home to Melbourne via Dubai instead of London on one of the last flights out before CDG was closed too) , one of my "B" plans which I was fermenting was to go back to Le Senate as I knew they would assist me even thought I'd checked out. We had a Superior room which was lovely, looking out onto the street. It was not a big room but was bigger than other standard rooms which I've stayed in in Paris before. There was a towel warmer - great for drying laundry!- and Hermes soap in little boxes. Gorgeous and luxe. The breakfast was included and although fine, I wouldn't pay extra for it given the many other local options out the door. Another bonus is free wi fi. This is an essential for me these days and given that more expensive hotels want to charge large amounts for this service, I think patronising hotels which include it in the rate, is "voting with your feet" as a consumer.I would stay here again without doubt

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: JEMPAM
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by very friendly and efficient staff at the check in desk. They answered all of our questions and supplied us with information and brochures about attractions. Our room was very nice and clean. Although I had prepared myself for the smallness of the rooms in Paris based on many reviews I had read -- I was still blown away. But of course that is no fault of the hotel personnel. Rooms are very close together. The room we stayed in (207) was next to the stairwell which housed their linen supplies. Housekeeping would go in and out many times creating a lot of noise. I would still recommend this hotel to almost anyone. Just not large persons.

Reviews.Title: “Chic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: zippy10k
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Senat for three nights on a family holiday. The hotel is really close to Luxembourg RER and there are quite a few metros around. The location is great for sightseeing and shopping. We arrived quite early and were expecting to just drop our bags off but they let us check into one of the two rooms. Both rooms were identical and pretty compact, although this is central Paris so to be expected. The rooms were of a high quality with nice decor and air conditioning. The showers had very high pressure and Hermes toiletries which were very nice. The rooms were quiet, as was the street. We had breakfast included in our room rate and this was very good each day although I would not pay the €17 per person to get it separately. There was a selection of pastries and breads each day, ham, salami and cheese, yoghurts, boiled eggs, and a few hot bits and bobs but we were too busy eating the pastries. The staff were extremely helpful and all spoke excellent English, and there was a real mix of nationalities staying. On our first night we asked the receptionist to recommend a local restaurant and she also made a booking for us - it was the Bouillon Racine just round the corner which was lovely. The Jardin du Luxembourg is a 100m away which is a really nice place to watch Parisians go by.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little Hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: DSLAyrshire
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel is ideally located just an easy 5/10 minute walk to RER, Metro and all the restaurants, cafes, bars and buzz of the Latin Quarter. At night it was an easy stroll back to the peace and quiet of the hotel for a good nights sleep on the very comfortable bed. The room we had, although smallish had all that was required and was tastefully furnished with a nice modern en-suite bathroom, self controlled heating and/or air conditioning. As nice as the hotel was, the real gem is to be found from the friendly and charming staff who went out of their way to make our visit as good as possible. unfortunately at the end of our planned stay I fell ill and we were unable to travel home as planned. Once again the staff proved up to the mark and made all the necessary arrangements with the Doctor, re-arranged accommodation etc. and generally assisted my wife to cope with what had become a stressful situation. I cannot recommend the staff highly enough and it is comforting to know that they look after you in both the pleasant and the not so pleasant aspects which can and do arise.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, spotless hotel with caring staff ideally placed to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: Creebenny
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Senat, in a lovely district of Paris just a short walk from the Odéon metro station, we were treated well. Offered a choice of two reasonably sized but exceedingly neat and bright rooms we were impressed by the condition and cleanliness, a theme which continues throughout the hotel. The bed proved comfy, the view pleasant and the breakfast diverse and hearty. However the thing that makes this stand out as a hidden gem is the courteousness nature of every staff member. We were given good advice on local eateries, including a map to find them, and were made to feel extremely comfortable during our whole stay. We had a wonderful time in Paris and would wholeheartedly recommend this fresh little hotel. As they say in France: "En petit champ croït bon blé..."

Reviews.Title: “We were not dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: BeltaneSomerset
Reviews.Content: We have learnt to trust Trip Advisor and insisted on this Hotel when we booked a Eurostar Trip from London to Paris through Thomas Cook, turning down other suggested places to stay. Although Paris has a brilliant Metro, you can see so much more by walking to your destinations, (well at least one way as there is a lot of ground to cover in a short three day trip). The location of this hotel was perfect and the hospitality very much appreciated. Our teenage daughters loved their room and were welcome here. We would have liked to have seen tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. There was one bottle of mineral water on arrival in each room, which perhaps could have been replaced on a daily basis, especially as clean glasses were provided. Fortunately there was a small grocery shop just across the road and loads of cafe/bars and restaurants nearby. We found, the beds really comfortable and the bed linen and towels crisp and clean. We would definitely consider returning to this little gem and would not hesitate in recommending this lovely little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: DaveColorado
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a recommendation from a business collegue that had stayed there in the past. The hotel was a great value for the money, and I would highly recommend it. It was quiet, staff was very helpful, and decent location - and again a very good value to Paris. I would recommend calling or email to see if you can get an even better rate than what is listed on their site as if they aren't too full they can be accomidating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel great value for money and a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonTigger
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Paris and had to write to say how much we enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Staff are very helpful particularly Enwar (apologies if I have mis-spelt your name) who was working on reception for most of the 4 days we spent here. The rooms are small but no hassle and the normal size I am led to understand for a lot of the hotels in Paris. If you have a good pair of walking boots and don't mind the exercise you can easily walk to most of the popular tourist attractions, if not there are a couple of Metro stations within 5 minutes walk and as previously said in another review the RER is only 2 minutes round the corner. The breakfast room is downstairs and can be a bit quiet if there are only a few guests there (maybe some low music could be played?) but lovely coffee, pastries etc whcih was all included in the price we paid and we found to be perfectly adequate. I would definitely stay here again without doubt and having travelled around Paris thoroughly we found this to be the best location with the hotel being great value for money. Thank you to all staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the 6th -- quiet but fully connected”
Reviews.Author: CAStein
Reviews.Content: I realize that many people here start talking about the great location of their accommodation. Indeed Paris is a widely beautiful, walkable city well-served by public transportation. This hotel fulfills this and provides comfortable, stylish accommodation with friendly, professional service. The hotel is located on the far eastern end of the important Rue de Vaugirard. This portion is a one way street and quiet (unlike the busier portions west of Luxembourg, Rue de Rennes ). Though very quiet, one finds adjacent the Luxembourg Gardens, Odeon Theater and good restaurants (e.g. Ferrandaise). One quiet block away one finds the RER Luxembourg station (line B -- direct from both airports) and surrounding fast food shops (McDonalds, Quick, Subway), larger cafes and a variety of shopping. A five minute (or less) walk takes you to the Odeon metro stop on the busy Blvd St. Germain de Pres in one direction and Blvd St Michel (more shopping) and the Sorbonne in another. A slightly longer walk takes one to the Pantheon or Ile de la Cite. A longer, but easily manageable for most (fifteen minutes or slightly longer), walk takes one the Louvre, D'Orsay, Marais, Montparnasse. Reserved a small double (used as single) and superior twin. Hotel upgraded to deluxe twin to be on the same floor as the single. Second floor twin featured sofa in addition to usual amenities and faced rear of property. Single faced the street but heard no complaints of noise from its occupant. Rooms were tastefully decorated, impeccably clean, had extremely almost luxurious bedding and were of good repair (mini-bar/tv stand was done a high gloss lacquer which showed prominently normal wear and tear). Traveling companion used and reported no problems with in room, free wi-fi. The floor had perhaps six rooms served by a typically small(ish) elevator -- we used the stairs. The ground floor features the reception area and bar decorated in the same stylish, contemporary style as the rooms. Such areas were comfortable and quiet. A computer was available for use of guests without charge at the far end of the lounge. Newspapers (incl. Herald Tribune) were offered here as well. Breakfast is located on lower level but we did not use. As this was not my first trip to Paris, I did not require much of the desk staff beyond information on neighborhood restaurants and updates on the looming RER strike. All such requests were handled quickly and professionally. Because of the RER strike the hotel called a taxi to take us to the airport. This required more than 60 eoros (much preferred the 8 euro (per person) RER ride!). Overall, a great four night stay in a great neighborhood. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny with stylish decor”
Reviews.Author: Greenish
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely staff, great decor - but such narrow corridors and tiny room that we had to take it in turns to walk from one side of the room to another. I guess for approx €150 a night we shouldn't complain, but for those of you who like space - don't go there. If you want a great location (Rive Gauche) then go for it. Americans please note - power shower!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: junioroz
Reviews.Content: The comments from the previous reviewer about the breakfast room are unfair. Yes it is on the lower level, but it is the best place in the hotel for it. Staff were always happy and eager to help. One the best hotels i've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great view from 6th floor rooms”
Reviews.Author: bernbe
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night, correct price for Paris standards. very good location across Jardins du Luxembourg. walking distance from Louvre, musee d'orsay,...,... didn't have breakfast, it's in the basement and you can find the same stuff "chez Paul" a 5 minutes walk from there. rooms were very quiet, no noise at all from streetlevel or neighbours. very helpfull and kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “good choice!”
Reviews.Author: 123abc012
Reviews.Content: good location helpful staff nice breakfast rooms are small - it's Paris! - but confortable

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and newly furbished, but very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: thepolarbeer
Reviews.Content: We picked this Hotel on location, and this did not disappoint - a very short stroll from the heart of St Germain. The rooms were newly decorated and clean, but small. They would still be comfortable enough, but there is no effective soundproofing, so you are at your neighbours' company throughout. This meant no sleeping in as cleaners and new guests arrived in the room next door. Day staff are friendly but night shift wasn't overly welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for that special occasion”
Reviews.Author: yollomHarrogate
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay as it was to celebrate my wife's special birthday. The welcome we received on arrival at the hotel was excellent. The American-style breakfast was very satisfying and provided a good balanced menu. We found our room to be absolutely first rate, the ensuite accomodation was ideal, towels etc of the finest quality, as too was the bed linen. The special touch was the bottle of champagne which really made my wife's birthday one to remember. David and Judith Molloy: Harrogate North Yorkshire: England

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: JettyBo
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay here. The room was a bit small, but we managed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: HelenCI
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after hours of searching for the right place to stay, for a first time visit to Paris to do the sights. Very easy to get to - RER to Luxembourg and 2 mins walks to the hotel. It's a good small boutique hotel, glad it was off the main road (as other have mentions the beds are very comfy - just the thing after hours of exploring Paris. Room & bathroom clean as a whistle & I'm fussy about these things). Excellent reception staff. The current exchange rate (£ to euro) dosen't help, but think the hotel rate was reasonable compared to the others I looked at. If you decided to book thorugh Venere.com - search for a discount code & you can get an extra 4% off. From the hotel lots of things are easy to walk to e.g. Notre Dame about 10 mins walk, Louvre about 15mins to name just 2... if you don't get distracted along the way :0)

Reviews.Title: “Good with a couple negatives”
Reviews.Author: LarryInBrookline
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY: Outstanding location, beautiful rooms, but a few negatives SPECIAL NOTE: Minutes from the RER line that goes to the Gare du Nord and Ch. de Gaulle airport, easy as pie MEMO TO HOTEL: Lose the dungeon breakfast room; use the upstairs bar and lounge as a morning eating area (Kensington House Hotel in London does this well, pay them a visit) PROS: 1) Beautiful decorating in the rooms, nice bathroom, quality TV, nice black and white photos, color scheme 2) Superb soundproofing. We had a lousy room, #102, right next to the elevator and close to street noise. Didn't hear a peep. 3) Excellent air condtioning 4) Free wifi 5) Fine operation and staff 6) Nice neighborhood, walk to many main locations 7) Very good restaurant next door when you don't want to go far: la ferrandaise CONS: 1) Overpriced 2) Breakfast is poor quality, in a cramped ugly basement room, the 15 Euro pricing is offensive 3) Lower floors in the front have no views

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, elegant hotel, ideally located”
Reviews.Author: shadowlite
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Le Senat during a recent long weekend site-seeing vacation in Paris. We were given a duplex room which consisted of a leisure area downstairs and a sleeping area upstairs. We had views both North and South across the Parisian rooftops, and could see The Louvre and Sacre-Coeur from the bedroom. The bathroom was decorated in black and white with wonderful natural light and an excellent shower. There was plenty of storage space in the room, with cupboards on both levels, as well as an in-room safe, drinks fridge and a television both upstairs and downstairs. Free wi-fi is available in all rooms, but a computer is also provided free of charge to guests in the ground floor reception room. The bar was available at all times and was a nice space to relax after a heavy day site-seeing. The staff were very friendly and helpful; they were patient with our attempts at speaking French, but helped us by speaking English also. For us, the location was ideal. A couple of minutes from the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg, and a short 5 minute walk from the Luxembourg RER stop or the Odeon Metro stop. From the hotel we could walk or use convenient transport links to visit all major attractions in the city, and there are many interesting restaurants nearby in the evening. We booked with HotelConnect.co.uk and the whole process was smooth and trouble-free. The buffet breakfast was included in our package and the breakfast room was perfectly sized for the venue, providing a selection of hot food, cold food and lovely pastries to set us up for the day. Although classed as a 3 star hotel, I would definitely say it was a superior 3 star and any quibbles were far too minor to detract from an enjoyable stay - we'd have happily stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “a great find”
Reviews.Author: bluJ
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying in this hotel. We had 2 rooms, one had just the bed the other had a bed and a sleeper sofa. The rooms were very clean, the beds very comfortable with cozy comforters. I usually dread European pillows, since they tend to feel like I am sleeping on a pair of folded jeans but this was a fantastic pillow. Our room faced a courtyard and it was completely silent, the kids room faced the street but they did not complain of any noise. The location is just great, a two minute stroll from Luxemburg Park. We did not want to have their breakfast since it was expensive so every morning I would run out across the street to a small market and a bakery around the corner. The staff were very sweet and polite. My only complaint is that in our room the toilet was separate from the bath and it was quite small. I laughed to my husband that if you lean forward while sitting on the toilet you can touch the door with your head. The bathroom with the bath and shower were good size. We will come back here next time. Loved the place

Reviews.Title: “Very good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: BetoPeixoto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights, before and after a cycle tour in Provence. I wanted to stay here mainly because it's near Luxembourg Park. The very well appointed room was extremely comfortable, clean and modern. The rate I got through Expedia was really good...122 euros. You can have breakfast in the hotel basement, but for the same money you can go to the next corner and have it in a cafe looking to Luxembourg Park. The staff was really helpful, specially when I missed my train to Avignon. In minutes they found out when was the next one and called a cab, in time for me to catch it. They also offer free wi-fi internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience!!”
Reviews.Author: pfig
Reviews.Content: Great English-speaking staff, Internet kiosk, air conditioning, location. The bed was amazing. Our room faced the street, which was a little noisy during the day (on the few times we were in the room during the day) but what street in Paris isn't noisy. It was, however, very quiet at night. Good continental breakfast and coffee. Within walking distance to the concentration of bars and restaurants near St. Germain Marche. Half a block from Jardin du Luxembourg. As we left, the overnight desk clerk was ridiculously helpful and insisted that we take croissants for the road as they had just been delivered. There is a laundromat plus a couple of small marts nearby also. Great little restaurant next door called La Ferrandaise and another at the corner called Au Père Louis, both with friendly staff, good food, good wine. Le Senat is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back here if we are ever in paris again.”
Reviews.Author: Joybells12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most comfortable one in our 19 days of travel in Paris and Italy. The beds were yummy and the view out our window was just what I would have wanted in Paris. Glorious! Staff was wonderful the whole 5 days we stayed there, very helpful, but the location almost spoke for itself, in the 6th arrondissment close to everything, could even walk to the Louve from here. St.Germain Des Pres is 10 minutes away. The Seine is also walking distance. Loved it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, reasonable prices...”
Reviews.Author: beckysayeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quiet and safe area of Paris (6th arrondissement) right near the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg. Many of the major sites of Paris can be reached on foot for by taking a short ride on the metro or the RER. The staff is extremely pleasant and accommodating. The accommodations were very cleaning, comfortable, and tastefully decorated. I plan to stay at this hotel again on my next trip to this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best lower cost hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: censington
Reviews.Content: Much better design than it's website or brochure suggest. Very helpful staff. Excellent value for money. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: parisng
Reviews.Content: The rooms are new and clean, the bathroom is very inviting and comfortable, the staff is nice and helpful, there is a charming lobby area that includes a computer with internet connection that can be used freely by the guests. The location is great: 2 minutes walk from the RER station (Luxembourg), that can be used to get directly to and from CDG airport and 3 minutes walk from a metro station (Odeon).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Nics17
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night Eurostar break for my birthday and chose the hotel on the basis of reviews here. We had a standard room (206) overlooking the courtyard - there wasn't much natural light but it was quiet. The room was small with a queen size bed and a comfortable mattress. Free internet was available in the lobby. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. Most tourist attractions were within walking distance and the Jardin de Luxembourg is on the doorstep There is a huge selection of restaurants nearby (I thoroughly recommend La Ferrandaise next door). We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Chic”
Reviews.Author: Linworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Tried the hotel on a recommendation. Being in the design business I tend to be a litle criticaI. I wasn't dissapointed. From the front desk, to the full buffet breakfast, confortable beds and linens, lots of hot water and heated towel racks. The standard rooms are a little on the small side but very adequate. If you want a bigger room then I would go for the deluxe with sofa , sitting area and mini bar. They have a very nice bar and internet is free. I highly recommend this hotel for those wanting a truly Parisian experience with a smile. Travelin

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: VirtuallyAnywhere
Reviews.Content: This was a repeat visit and was as nice as I had remembered it. This is a smallish hotel very close to the Luxembourg Garden. Access to the upper floors through a small lift or steep staircase may make it a challenge for some. The bar area is cozy, the room and bed were comfortable (if a bit small) and the ambiance was very nice. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. As I pass through Paris enroute to/from other European cities, this makes an ideal rest stop.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: PickleBrighton_UK
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in Paris. The rates are quite high, but worth it. We had a great room on the top floor, a little small, but very modern. Decorated in a boutique style; it had a comfy double bed, flat screen TV, lovely bathroom again very modern all decorated in white with bath and power shower. We had a small balcony which looked over the street and distant views of the city. The reception/bar/lounge area was very nicely decorated with a modern, clean feel. The staff were very friendly, giving advice on where to eat/visit etc. The breakfast was good, a small buffet, but had everything you needed and some hot dishes. This hotel is located in the Saint Germain des Pres area very near the Latin Quarter and only a 5 min walk to the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. We arrived in Gare Du Nord station and took the Metro to the Odeon station, took about 30 mins. We were out and about every day during our four night visit and very easy from the hotel. Just a 5-8 min walk to the metro Odeon station or a 15 min walk to the Notre Dame area. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and stay here again myself, it’s a good choice and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near the Luxembourg gardens”
Reviews.Author: ruthsf
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Modern, clean, and very relaxing. Modern amenities. The best thing about this hotel is the service. The reception desk is always very nice, courteous, and happy to help, even with my limited and poor French. My boyfriend and I had a very relaxing stay here. It's in a good quiet location. Near the gardens, near a bus stop, near enough to a metro stop, a stone's throw away from an awesome wine bar (always packed at night!), and near good restaurants, on the cheap side and otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “NOT REALLY A BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: penguinitis
Reviews.Content: Travel agent booked a Liberty Travel / GOGO package for a classic room with breakfast week 9/17-9/23.
