Asked for a garden view, got a very noisy street view room, because it was larger, but it had dirty carpet and soiled wallpaper. It did have a safe. The rooms are absolutely teenie weenie. cute photos on web site make the property look chic. Hotel was renovated in 2004, but it really needs to be freshend up. Room 307 had a desk chair and was too small for two people. We took room 305. We lived out of a suitcase for the week, no drawers, only four cubbies and a tiny closet. Black marble bathroom was small but clean and had hot water. Mauro, the night front desk man is a gem. Breakfast room is in a basement with dark gray walls & needs better lighting. Food that should be hot is not. It really is not worth the 15 Euro charge if one is paying for it. This was our first stay on the left bank in the 6th Arr. of five visits to Paris. We should have found a hotel nearer to the Blvd. St. Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: Marie19a
Reviews.Content: It's funny how people can have a totally different experience at the same hotel. In contrast to the previous reviewer, I have to say that the bed I slept in at the Senat was so comfortable I could hardly bear to get out of it! Very stylish decor and well appointed - although beware if you're very tall/large as the bathroom & toilet are teeny-tiny. We also kept bumping into one another as there's not much space to circulate in the room! But apart from that it's great - location is excellent. You can park in the Vinci near Soufflot but it's pretty expensive (€25 per day). Probably best to avoid driving here if you can. Staff were very helpful - set us up with free internet access, booked a restaurant for us etc. We booked with Expedia and breakfast was included - and it was fantastic. Buffet style with bacon, eggs, sausages, ham, cheese as well as pastries and rolls. I think for the location and standard of accommodation it was pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but quite expensive”
Reviews.Author: Atkinson's
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Hotel Le Senat the first was a couple of year’s ago and we chose to come back mainly for the location and the assurance of good service. The location of the hotel is superb. It is easy to get to on the Metro and RER – the RER is closer if you are concerned about carrying baggage. Just a quick point about travelling in Paris, the public transport system is excellent but we purchased a carnet (pack of ten) tickets for the metro/bus/RER from Ashford International Station in advance of arriving in Paris and none of them worked in the barriers at Gare Du Nord. We had to queue for a long time at Gare Du Nord (this was a Sunday afternoon when you may expect it to be quiet) to buy more tickets from a machine, of which there are very few in the station and which has no translation of the French instructions. This was not an isolated problem a number of people were experiencing it and all were complaining to themselves as there seemed to be no staff available to complain to or help to sort the problem out. Back to the hotel, the location of the Hotel Le Senat is excellent. It is close to the Jardin Du Luxembourg which is beautiful, it is a stroll away from the left bank and Notre Dame. You can get an excellent boat trip from Pont Neuf for €10 each taking in all the usual sights this is also in easy walking distance. The area around the hotel is full of interesting bars and restaurants, in particular we had a wonderful meal in the Aux 2 Olivieres which is a 2 minute walk turning right out of the hotel. We had breakfast once in the hotel which included a buffet of pastries, scrambled egg, bacon, and toast, coffee, tea and hot chocolate but it is expensive at €15 each. It is much cheaper to get breakfast somewhere else and there are many places to choose from within easy walking distance of the hotel. The room was ok, it is a little small but it is an old building and that is part of the charm. The noise mentioned by other people may be worse for the people in suites on the top floors because the walls are probably thinner there. We didn’t really experience noise from next door only noise from the terrace furniture upstairs being scraped across the decking late at night. The room was clean enough and the towels were changed daily. The furnishings were fairly modern. We did not have a mini bar as quoted on the internet. The shower head was broken and the head angle could not be adjusted so it sprayed water all over the bathroom, not our problem as much as the cleaners. The rooms at Le Senat are quite expensive. We saw what appeared to be very nice hotels in the immediate area that were quoting prices on their tariff boards getting on for €80 less per night which is not insignificant but we have no idea what these hotels are like generally or what individuals want from their stay. If all they want is a base to come back to then shop around. If service and quality are important then you can’t go far wrong with Le Senat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not faultless”
Reviews.Author: cdmarron
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in the Le Senat hotel on our second trip to Paris. We were looking to stay around the St Germain de Pres or Latin Quarter areas in order to be a bit closer to things, and the hotel seemed to get good reviews on Tripadvisor. The location of the hotel was great! Close to the Jardin de Luxembourg, and with some absolutely fabulous restaurants right next door (Le Ferrandaise and Au Pere Louis) you did not need to venture far to find a good Parisian meal. There were also some good local cafe bars, and all of the restaurants and bars were frequented by local Parisians. There were very good boulangeries and 'mini-markets' just around the corner which we used every day for breakfast (baguettes, croque monsieur, croissants, whatever you like, and coffee and orange juice supplied there) which for 9.30 Euro for 2 people was certainly a much better deal than the hotel breakfast at 15 Euro per person! We booked through the hotel website and booked a 'Classic Double' and were given a room (502) with a balcony which was a real plus for enjoying a glass of wine and watching the world go by. However, we had decided to book one room up from their 'standard' room, and even at that the room was small and without a balcony it would have been very claustrophobic for 4 nights! (It was certainly much smaller than the previous room we stayed in, last time in Paris, for less money) Secondly, the bed was not comfortable and after the second night we found that we were starting to waken with backaches etc and general grumbles. Third, there are real problems with transmitted noise from other rooms. We were woken on a couple occasions by the couple in the next room returning late at night - not that they were boistorous, but rather that you could hear conversations and TV noise transmitted through the wall, as well as very loud bangs of their door closing every time they went in or out of the room. We did have a great stay in Paris, and the location of the hotel certainly did make up for some of the issues such as the room size and noise, but lack of a good bed might put us off staying in that particular hotel again if we were to be in Paris for more than 2 nights - but we are now armed with names of other hotels in the same area to try next time...! I have rated the hotel a 3, but in reality it is probably a 3.5-4 so I may seem a bit harsh, but such is the reality of some of the problems that there are! Oh, and you should check our the 'Bike About' bike tour we did and I have reviewed - a great way to get slightly off the beaten track!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TheGrimesReview
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Paris and we wanted to stay in the St Germain area. Having checked Trip Advisor for hotels the reviews for this hotel stood out. The hotel is as previous reviewers have said located very near Luxembourg RER station which is the direct train from Charles De Gaulle. The hotel itself is well maintained and as expected the rooms are very clean if a bit small. However as with most city breaks spending time in the room does not tend to happen much. Breakfast was included in our cost and it was sufficient with enough choice to set you up for the day ahead. The gardens across the road are worth a visit and so is Au Petit Suisse bistro just down from the hotel on the corner directly across from the main entrance to the gardens. A nice vino and some people watching is well worth trying out. Location is great if you turn left when coming out hotel you will end up on Boulevard St Michel which will take you directly to the river and Notre Dame etc. If you turn right it will take you into the heart of St Germain area. No complaints on the hotel at all and lived up to its reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel...Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: Ol_Lurch
Reviews.Content: Le Senat provided service beyond my expectations at a time that I most desparately needed help. KLM had sent my luggage to the wrong city one stop before Paris on a multi-city trip and were deflecting my efforts to recover it with "customer service". The staff at Le Senat showed genuine compassion, and despite having no dedicated concierge staff, spent extra hours assisting me. They did not accept the dismissive or absurd responses from Air France, traced back to someone at KLM who genuinely helped, and ultimately persuaded someone in the bowels of Charles de Gaulle airport to exceed the requirments of her job to deliever the bag to me. This took days of persistence by several desk staff while they maintained excellent service for other guests, suggesting great restaurants and giving tourist tips. All of this service deserved a substantial gratuity which they refused despite several efforts on my part ; stating they were just happy to be of assistance. Yes, there are some small inconveniences as noted in other reviews, but as a frequent traveller who has stayed at 5 star properties, I recommend the hotel Le Senal for the most personally satisfying service I have received.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SpikeydogDurham
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the hotel was very pleasant, the rooms are clean and stylish and the bathroom was spotlessly clean. Plenty of towels and the complimentary toiletries were Hermes, which was a bonus. The hotel is in a great location and the Jardins de Luxembourg are a five minute walk away. The downside to our stay at the hotel was the breakfast, priced at 15 euros, very little choice of hot food, and a small amount of cold food to choose from, also we had to constantly ask for bowls, plates, cutlery etc. as there was none to be found in the buffet area. However the great location of the hotel and the friendly staff made up for this and overall we had a great stay in the hotel and a very enjoyable three days in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: travelling_scampi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Senat was a really great find. It is located just around the corner from the gorgeous Luxembourg Gardens, near the Odeon Metro station and the Luxembourg RER station for easy transport access, and the area is filled with great restaurants and incredible shopping. On top of this, the hotel is very quiet, pretty, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are on the small side, but typical for Paris, and are a decent value (especially if you find them on sale through travel websites) with a good breakfast included. The one minor annoyance is the single phone-booth-sized elevator - if everyone decides to go to breakfast around the same time or people arrive with lots of luggage, you can occasionally have to wait a bit. Overall, we loved our stay here and will be back next time. The location is perfect for enjoying the best aspects of Paris. If you go, be sure to check out all of the activities in the Luxembourg Gardens, like the marionette theatre and the very active petanque playing on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Wadger
Reviews.Content: After having read everything on Trip Advisor about this place, I can say that I wasn't disappointed at all. Yes, you must be prepared for the SMALL rooms. If this is the norm in Paris, than I think we did alright. The rooms are very modern. It was nice to have a safe too. The hotel staff were very friendly and spoke perfect English. We had been worried about having no French language skills, but they were wonderful and were able to answer all of our questions. Breakfast was included and it was a great way to start off each morning. The location is excellent. The Saint Germaine Des Pres area has so much to offer. We were here during a Metro strike and we were able to walk to everything. The Arc Da Tremphe, The Eiffel Tower, The Louvre, The Luxemburg Gardens and Notre Dame Cathedral. The hop on, hop off boat tours on the Seine were a great way to travel during the metro strike. Well worth the money. The bistros and restaurants in the area are plentiful. We didn't have one bad experience. Although when walking down the side roads for the first time, make sure to check out all the bistros before you get lured into one. Some are definately nicer than others. Even the pizza from the little vendors tastes amazing. Thank you trip advisor for helping us to pick this hotel for our first and definately not last stay in Paris. Sheldon and Marianna Sudbury, ON Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great little find in the latin quarter”
Reviews.Author: maynris
Reviews.Content: At the last minute we were looking for accommodation to attend the Rugby World Cup Final and considering we thought we'd end up in a box on the outskirts of Paris we couldn't believe our luck when we came across Le Senat with a cancellation room. It's a lovely small hotel in a quiet road a few minutes walk from the Luxembourg Gardens which I've now realised are a must on every visit to Paris. The reception areas are fairly small as with most boutique hotels but beautifully decorated and furnished with contemporary wallpapers and fabrics offset with the kind of lovely flower arrangements that make a statement. In the corner of the lounge is a laptop with broadband for anyone to use gratis. The rooms were small but again tastfully furnished with everything you need and everything worked. Staff are helpful and friendly and very quickly knew our name. It's been reported in previous reviews that parking is a nightmare. It's not easy because the road is one way and there's no parking outside the hotel but we rang the hotel beforehand and they suggested a car park in Rue Soufflot. We parked there first and then walked our luggage to the hotel and it was no more than 5 mins. I need to review the car park as well. It was underground, heated and the cleanest car park I've ever seen. Very secure and not expensive. We joked that had we not found a hotel we'd have been quite happy to sleep in the car as there were even loos! All in all we couldn't fault our stay at Le Senat and would definitely consider staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arthur2007
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Hotel Le Senat and we have to say it is a gem. The hotel is located near to the Luxemborg Gardens and 3 mins walking distance from the Odeon Metro station and Luxemborg RER station, so it was very easy to transfer to the airport and main train station. Also walking distance to Notre Dame, Latin Quarter, Lourve and shopping in the St Germain area. The room booked was a Deluxe room, not so large but parisian size....but the room was very clean. Buffet Breakfast is only 15 euros with a lot of choice and godd quality.The staff was friendly,helpful, polite. Hotel is very well located in the best area of Paris All rooms have air con and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone who wanted a nice Paris break. You have a free internet access in the lobby or in the hotel, you have a free Wifi. When you arrive in your room, you also have a free bottle of water, not so bad.... I'd recommend this hotel without question to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC30something
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and had an excellent stay. The hotel is well-located near to restauarnts and shops in St. Germain and is very near to the Luxembourg Gardens. Our room was modest in size, but by no means too small and was also nicely decorated and very quiet and clean. I highly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: detoxed
Reviews.Content: The plus point is its location close to the jardin du Luxembourg and Boulevard St. Michel. The décor is modern and in a relatively OK state. The bathroom was clean and the shower worked well with instant hot water. However, given the price, one would expect a lot more. The room was small and dark with the bed taking up most of the space. Some of the fixtures were broken or did not work. This hotel skimps on basics - no bathrobe, only one bath towel, limited toiletries. The staff were not rude but give the impression that they are not really bothered whether you stay or not. At check out, they hand you the bill and your credit card, but don't expect them to ask whether you enjoyed your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris pad!”
Reviews.Author: julesy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a work colleague, and it did not disappoint! We wanted to stay in the Latin Quarter as we really enjoy the restaurants/night life in that area, aside from the fact that it's very pretty and well located to explore the rest of Paris. This little hotel was perfect for all our needs. We had a slight wait on our room but we did arrive at 9am or something crazy. The friendly receptionist answered all our questions as we waited and offered us an upgrade to a rooftop two-storey room (which we were able to view for ourselves) for more Euros, but we decided to keep the room we had on the third floor and save our pennies for the often-expensive Paris meals. We were, after all, only there to sleep and our room on the third floor was more than adequate with a huge comfy bed, modern furnishings, flat screen TV, small balcony overlooking the quaint street below and a wonderful bathroom full of Hermes products - a lovely touch. We chose not to eat breakfast at the hotel as it was more fun and a cheaper option to just walk down any of the surrounding streets and find a little cafe and eat with the locals. I can happily recommend the cafe on the corner - as you walk out the front door head right down towards Luxembourg Gardens and you will see this particular cafe with the red awning. We ate there on our last morning and it was not only a beautiful outlook to the Gardens but also a quintessential Parisian experience - the tables on the path all facing outwards and basking in the sunshine, seemingly no other tourists eating there and the minimal-English-speaking waiter to challenge our basic "baguette", "croque monsieur" and "caffe" grasp of French breakfast terminology! Oh, and the croques and coffees were great! If you're into fitness may I also suggest a morning run around the Gardens. We did it one day and it was just beautiful, and full of locals doing the same thing. While I'm recommending Paris experiences can I also say you really must catch the train out to Versailles if you get the chance - we did it this time and it was magnificent, I'm so glad we decided to as it was just beautiful, and the little town itself is very quaint with lots of great cafes, bars & restaurants.... after the hours you spend walking the Chateau and its amazing grounds you'll be up for a beer! Le Senat was a true "find" and we will for sure stay there again on our next trip to Paris. For the E185 we paid for a balcony room we felt it was very reasonable given the hotel was so modern and clean, in a great location and with friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: dreamgirl_7
Reviews.Content: When I returned to Paris 9 months later I knew I had to stay at hotel Senat. It was like returning home for me. I love the location and the friendly and helpful staff. I stayed in Paris for 8 days both times and enjoyed the 5th floor with a balcony. I had a view of the palace in Jardin du Luxembourg, which I enjoy spending time at. The hotel is very contemporary and charming. I've spent time at the bar and had breakfast downstairs...very good. I tell all my friends about this place. I really enjoy the neighborhood and the non-touristy feel. ...Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pamperednyc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a very cute and clean hotel in a great location. Front staff were friendly and good breakfast that was included. Room is tiny tiny tiny (par for Paris). Large suitcases barely fit through the halls, never mind your room. It's a basic no frills small hotel. No bellhop, no concierge, no room service other than bringing up your continental breakfast.. Comfortable though with everything you basically need. I'd probably try the Hotel Luxembourg next time - looked nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: seiden
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel le Senat for our honeymoon. The hotel staff was very friendly. The rooms were a bit small, but that was expected based on previous reviews. View from the balcony was awesome. Location was great! Would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SundevilStudent
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and had a great experience. The staff was wonderful and eager to help make our trip as great as it could be. The location was wonderful as well as it is near both an RER station as well as a regular Metro station. The hotel is close enough to nightlife and restaurants that you can walk there in only a few minutes but is on a small street so you're not kept up by traffic at night. The room size was on par with other hotels in Paris but they were exceptionally clean and the beds were super comfortable, the Hermes bath products didn't hurt either. The breakfast was great but you could save the 15 Euros a day that you spend on breakfast by grabbing something at the bakery down the street. There is a bar in the hotel but I only saw it being used once during my stay. Overall it's a great hotel in a great location with a staff that really wants to make your trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Rive Gauche charm”
Reviews.Author: BoutiqueJunkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Le Senat in December 2006 and truly enjoyed my stay. The location is very handy, within walking distance to Luxembourg RER station, so it was easy to get to the hotel from airport. The rooms are small, but nicely decorated and have that real, genuine 'Parisien' charm. The street has almost no traffic at all, so it was nice and quiet.The bathrooms are beautiful with black and white tiling. Big plus for the quality Hermés toiletries! The location is perfect for quality shopping in Saint Germain de Pres, lots of great shopping to be done there. Near the hotel is a lovely little pastry shop 'Gerard Mulot'- do not miss it! There are also lots of small, cosy restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel for couples on a short city break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: bigpips
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, great standard of service, great breakfast, lovely stylish interior, close to Parc De Luxemberg which is great for a stroll around or watching boules. Latin quarter 5 mins, river 15 mins walk, lots of great bars and places to eat in areas 5 and 6. I hate the mad rush tour group areas of The Eifel Tower and Notre Dame, the left bank with its small retaurants and bars, little patisseries and choclatiers is just what i want. Far more relaxed and honest picture of Paris for me. main attractions are full of scam artists and hastle. i would not go anywhere near those areas, not worth the fuss. Muse D'Orcey was fantastic and only 15mins walk away. Louvre 20 mins walk over the river, not as good as D'Orcey but still worth a visit. breakfast! great pastry, cheeses, meats, sausage, bacon, scrambled egg, fruit, juices and cerial. fantastic coffee! can also get breakfast in bed for no extra charge. rooms tastefully done, lots of good hot water with full preasure. staff really helpful and very accomodating. I will use the hotel again next time i go.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: JCTravellerDublin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Le Senat hotel for 4 nights from 23rd to 27th March 07. This was our second time at the hotel, having stayed there for a few nights in 2004. The hotel was well situated, only 10 minutes from the Saint Germain area and all its restaurants, yet on a quiet, safe side-street. Our room was very comfortable with a queen-size bed, desk and chair, TV on the wall, and decent sized bathroom. The room which overlooked the street below had a balcony, and plenty of light filled the room. On a downside there was no full-length mirror in the room (perhaps more important for us girls!) and there was only one english speaking channel on the TV (CNN) as the BBC channel didn't work. The hot and cold buffet breakfast which was served in the basement of the hotel was ok, although if I were to stay here again I would pick up something in one if the many brasseries nearby. The hotel was very clean, with a modern contempory decor. In contrast to some other visitors who have provided reviews we found the hotel staff to be very polite and friendly; the reception staff were helpful in providing us with tourist maps and advised us on nearby metro stations. In terms of getting we used the Metro and found a pack of 10 tickets (priced just over Euro 10) to go a long way. The nearest Metro stop is Odeon which is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Recommended restaurants nearby include Les Editeurs and Le Comptoir (both beside the Odeon metro stop). Le Coupe-Chou (11 Rue to Lanneau) is also highly recommended. Overall, we had a very comfortable stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean hotel and helpful stuff”
Reviews.Author: SJEngineer
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms. Good breakfast. Excellent location. Stuff spoke good English and was helpful. I had an odd problem with key card not working on first try on few occasions. I did not want to wait for them to change lock and moved to the next room. I assume that was a fluke.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, nice but not great value”
Reviews.Author: wanderer2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently> We booked a deluxe room , without breakfast, which cost 255 Euro /night. This is a nice hotel, with stylish modern decor and well-kept rooms. Some of the rooms are very cramped , however, even the junior suites. The deluxe room we ended up with was of a reasonable size but not large, with a nice terrace facing inwards, so light was poor and no view. The bed was 180cm wide and excellent. The bathroom was satisfactory and clean but very normal and the seperate toilet was very cramped. Service from reception was friendly and helpful. Ovarall this was a comfortable , pleasant place to stay but for the price I expected more - eg bigger rooms, better bathrooms, breakfast. There did not seem to be many advantages to staying here over some of the much cheaper 2 star hotels in the area, which can also be very nice.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: Enveloppe
Reviews.Content: After reading the amazing reviews on this website, I booked a one night stay at this hotel with my boyfriend, for a weekend stopover on our way back to London from the south of France. Reading these reviews is where the pleasure ended. On arrival the staff barely acknowledged us - let alone smiled or made us feel welcome. I booked this hotel above many other glowing recommendations in the city in the hope of getting a balcony room - which we did get in the end - but there was no promise one would be available (why not, I wonder, if you're prepared to pay for it?) and the staff managed to make me feel as though I was being rude for even asking. On being shown to the room, I was surprised at how small it was, given the price we were paying. I know Paris rooms are small generally, but you could barely get round the bed, and clearly we were not paying for charming service. Admittedly the bed was super-comfy, but I'm afraid I ask more of a hotel than a comfy bed. That evening a downpour arrived out of nowhere just as we were leaving for dinner - the receptionist reluctantly attempted to obtain a taxi for us, and when it was clear nothing would be coming (I know - such is Paris) we asked if we could borrow an umbrella...but this was obviously asking too much...the lady told us they had none to lend but would be prepared to sell us one instead!! Crazy - I do really wonder what we paid for. The sour nature of the staff carried on the next day, when we checked out - as early as we could. I wonder if the hotel didn't like our sort (we arrived early off an overnight train and used the hotel facilities to change and freshen up - our room wasn't ready), we are young, we didn't have matching Louis Vuitton luggage, and we laughed as we came in from the rain, quite late at night. I have lived in Paris before and know it very well - admittedly not as a tourist - but I was amazed by the attitude of the staff here. I advise you to pay less and have the prospect of a decent welcome from the staff - or even pay more and put up with snooty staff in return for a decent room. I have no idea who this hotel is aiming itself at, but clearly it's not me or any of my friends or colleagues, all of whom I will urge to stay well clear!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: michy46
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Le Senat 27th oct for weekend, staff were fantastic, hotel lovely, rooms very very small but the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in with great decor and very clean. location lovely by luxembourg gardens with easy access to many resteraunts and bars. would definately go back

Reviews.Title: “A gem in St Germain”
Reviews.Author: LondonJan
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay at Le Senat through Airmiles and were happy with every aspect of our stay. Access from Gare du Nord is easy, and everything is fabulously close. The Luxembourg gardens are literally across the road, which is a major bonus for families with young children. The playground there is brilliant, and on weekends there are pony rides and toy sail boats for hire. (Its also where the final scene in the movie Madeline was filmed, in case you have a Madeline-mad girl). The hotel has been beautifully renovated. Everything is of course small scale (the elevator will only fit three people) but that is not a surprise in Paris. We were upgraded to a suite, which meant our 7 year old daughter had a sofabed in the sitting room and a door divided her room from ours. We had a shower room as well as a bathroom (room 506) and the outlook was onto an internal courtyard, which we didn't mind as it was very quiet. We heard no noise from other rooms even though the hotel was full. Our bed was blissfully comfortable. Breakfast is the usual buffet, but was perfectly adequate. Staff were helpful and friendly - even producing plasters for blisters on small child's heels, and providing room service out of the usual hours. The children in the hotel were treated as special guests - no stuffiness, and more than a little good humour. This hotel was a joy to return to. And the bar NEVER closes, which says a lot about the way they run the place.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: F30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel le Senat for a long weekend last weekend and had such a fantastic time, I didn't want to leave. I was with two other people and we all left saying we would be back. Apart from the elegant décor and the fantastically comfortable beds, the warmth of the hotel staff really made the weekend special. I have been to Paris on a number of occasions but have to say that I have never enjoyed a trip as much as this one. Big bathtubs for soaking in after a day walking around the city, hot fluffy towels, beautiful bedlinen, pillows to die for..I loved every minute of it and will definitely return. Rather than eating in the hotel, we had breakfast each morning at a little café down the street (Au Petit Suisse) and would definitely recommend it. The staff there were lovely too. A memorable weekend in a memorable city in a memorable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic..FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: crunkyfairy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, Clean great staff that gave and printed out direction to places for us to see in the morning. Like most hotel rooms in paris its not the most spacious, but hey! its Paris! what do u expect? The deco is modern and sleek, not over the top. Comfortable, quiet and pretty. Its in a great location, central, but not on a main street, around the cornerr from luxembourg and le odeon. We got free breakfast with out offer. And i have to say the best hotel we've stayed in Paris. And at a resonable price too. We had originallly booked a 4*hotel with lastminute.com, when we arrived it was in a terrible area, and they were an hour late on the scheduled check in. We decided to look for a different hotel, we stumbled upon this on 3* cheaper than the other one and must better kept, in a better location and better service..and without the smell either. it made my birthday special! thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: caktraveller
Reviews.Content: My basic expectations of this hotel were cleanliness and location. We stayed here for 5 nights which was a long time to be in such a small room but in the end, there's too much to see in Paris so we didn't spend too much time in there anyways. Because it's website refers to it as "one of the top hotels in rive gauche" I was expecting above average service but was surprised when our phone messages were delivered hours late and our request for extra towels was met with confusion. The front desk was not very social. There wasn't the typical Hello/Bonjour, Good Evening/Bon Soir as at most hotels. That maybe be a cultural difference. Overall, I was pleased with the hotel but there are too many cute hotels in that area to go back to Le Senat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CoastKid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Senat Hotel in St Germain de Pres in Paris and loved it. Do not expect large rooms but the one we were in had a larger than queen size bed, small sofa, well appointed bathroom with Hermes amenities and was very clean. We didn't take the breakfast at 15 Euro per person but we should have - not much in the area for less (do try the ouefs au plat and cafe creme at Cafe de Flores on Boulevard St Germain and Rue de Rennes). Staff at the hotel were very helpful and spoke English very well. We got a great deal of 145 Euro per night off the hotel's website - for Canadians and Americans, remember that is the total, no taxes added on unlike North American cities which range from 10-18% on top of the rate. Area around hotel was quiet, across the street from Jardin du Luxembourg - loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon In Paris”
Reviews.Author: WaikikiQueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Le Senat for 7 days on our honeymoon in Paris and returned for 2 our last two nights in Europe. The hotel service was excellent! The rooms were small but spotless! You can't ask for much more than that in Paris. We were there during the heatwave and every night we curl up in our nice COLD room because they always turn the air conditioning on when you leave. The area couldn't have been better. It was our first time in Paris and we took the RER train from the Airport to the Luxemburg station which was two blocks away (very easy to find the hotel from there). The neighbourhood was lively and action packed! A comfortable hotel room makes Paris all the more enjoyable! Victoria, BC, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: sirius99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights during April 2006. We had the chance to view all types of rooms and select the one we liked. The standard room is very small and unpleasant. The deluxe and the suite are very nice rooms and it is worth while to spend the difference in price. The hotel must have been renovated recently. The decoration is modern (reminds Margritte), but nothing special. The bed and the bathroom were excellent and all rooms are good isolated, though occasionally there is some noise from inside, especially if the hotel is full. The personnel is very friendly and helpful. The most valuable advantage of this hotel is the location. Near Odeon and Jardin du Luxembourg, in St. Germain, this neighborhood is very calm and convenient to most destinations. Metro, bus stations and nice restaurants/bistros are very close. If the atmosphere/decoration of the hotel is not the most important criterion this hotel is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nicky090
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Everyone was so friendly and the rooms were fine. We stayed in the room with the upstairs bedroom which has plenty of space. Our brother stayed in a single room and said it was big enough and was very quiet,looking out at the courtyard. He also had a small area with a table and chairs. So, we did not feel the rooms were too small.You do pay for the breakfast, but it is a buffet with plenty of warm and cold food, not just a continental breakfast. We also had tea and coffee brought to us early each morning, which was there within 5 minutes of ordering it. The staff spoke excellent English and was very helpful with tips about where to eat and what exhibits to see. We liked this hotel so much we are going back in May,and definately recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraBec
Reviews.Content: hi! we have been in Senat for 5 nights in august 2005. great hotel. very friendly staff, very clean, good breakfast, great location. in total: try it!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel le Senat
HotelInfo.Address: 10 rue de Vaugirard | 6th Arr., 75006 Paris, France
